title: Nicola Sturgeon says 'unfair' Brexit deal means Scots must have new independence vote
text:
Nicola Sturgeon said her MPs would vote against Boris Johnson’s deal and claimed it was now “clearer than ever” that independence was the best future for Scotland.

The First Minister claimed the agreement reached with the EU meant Scotland was the only part of the UK being treated “unfairly”.

She has repeatedly warned that a no-deal Brexit would be a disaster for families, businesses and the economy, but took to social media almost immediately to say the SNP would not back Boris Johnson's new deal.

Her comments were at odds with the views of Scotland's fishermen, and small business leaders, who welcomed the last minute agreement.

Jackson Carlaw, interim leader of the Scottish Conservatives, said...
description: Nicola Sturgeon said her MPs would vote against Boris Johnson’s deal and claimed it was now “clearer than ever” that independence was the best future for Scotland.
